post_text: Thank you to: Bryon Allen, Julio Canales, Damian Canales, Angel Canales, Elias Canales, and Pedro Garcia! We are Pittsburg Proud and Grateful for these young men! They even took the time to show them where the leak was on the field. Thanks to them, our Maintenance Department, led by Matt Belasco, was able to turn the water off and fix the broken pipe. By taking the time to care, these young men saved thousands of gallons of water and saved the field from potential damages. Today, we recognized them with Good Citizen Certificates and Gift Cards. ..and it was sooo nice to see students in person! :) They currently attend Los Medanos Elementary, Rancho Medanos Jr High, and Pittsburg High School.

shared_text:
Parkside Elementary School
September 1 at 2:10 PM ·

Since the beginning of time we have taught our children face to face from generation to generation.
Throwing our kids in front of a screen is not part of the natural learning process. We all know this and we all feel it. Everyone is yearning to return to our classroom to interact with real human beings.

Meanwhile, our kids do their best and we have to accept that is their best until we return them to a more nurturing process that gets them ready to be adults.

Our teachers became teachers because of a natural drive within them to prepare younger generations to become successful adults. Teaching in front of a computer is hard for our teachers as well. However, we must praise our teachers for doing what they do well, that is taking a very difficult situation and pushing through to reach and teach our kids and families.

So, a huge thank you to the most amazing teachers and families that are working together to continue our education and get our kids back into the classroom safely.

Thank you Parkside staff and families. We will get through this together. 😁

I decided to use the website: Desmos.com. So, I created a YouTube tutorials on how to plot coordinate points and create polygons in Desmos. My students spent one week relearning how to find distance between points and apply it to perimeter of polygons on the coordinate plane. At the end of the week, they did a polygon picture for Mother’s Day. Several kids told me they liked the Desmos activities, so the following week, I gave an option to create their own polygon pictures using only coordinate points and polygons. These are their results." What a cool project, right? Thank you, Ms. Torres for sharing these projects with us. Your students are SO TALENTED! #RanchoRocks #MathandArt #PittsburgPride Pittsburg Unified School District

This is a video featuring photos of all our PUSD principals, along with written text from Dr. Janet Schulze. Happy National Principals' Day! We appreciate our Principals so much.

“Today is National School Principals’ Day! Today we make time for a special recognition of all of our principals for their leadership and dedication to providing the best education and opportunity for our students. Principals fill many roles and ours all do so masterfully. They juggle many different issues at once and they do this all while maintaining the focus on making sure each of our scholars receives the best. They support their teachers and staffs and their families and students every day. They provide this leadership with a smile. This anonymous quote describes our Pittsburg Principals: “Work-Life Alignment: When what you DO aligns with who you ARE.” Please join me in celebrating our Pittsburg Principals! The Best!”

- Dr. Janet Schulze, Proud Superintendent of Pittsburg Unified School District

post_text: Pittsburg High teamed up with Pittsburg Police Department, Pittsburg, CA to bring students a glimpse of what can happen when you drink and drive or drive while high. Students, staff, and Pittsburg police officers along with the Contra Costa DA shot this video before the "self-isolation" was ordered. Normally, this is a program called "Every 15 Minutes" and it is done every other year at PHS. This year, due to the current situation, we could not do the program as it is "normally" done. So, we bring you this dramatic video...which is very realistic of what can happen if you drink and get behind the wheel or smoke weed and drive. Please show your teens this video and remind them that someone dies every 15 minutes in an accident that involved a driver who got behind the wheel while intoxicated. Thank you, Devin, of Framed Famous Productions, Pittsburg Police Department and all of the students and staff that participated in this important video. https://youtu.be/ezyYrnXbP2U

Pittsburg High teamed up with Pittsburg Police Department, Pittsburg, CA to bring students a glimpse of what can happen when you drink and drive or drive while high. Students, staff, and Pittsburg police officers along with the Contra Costa DA shot this video before the "self-isolation" was ordered. Please show your teens this video and remind them that someone dies every 15 minutes in an accident that involved a driver who got behind the wheel while intoxicated. During this day of service, students are encouraged to get involved in their communities by identifying issues and working to resolve them. Your kids do not need to attend a particular school. You can pick up meals at ANY of these sites. No IDs are required. FREE breakfast and lunch grab n go's will be available.
Pittsburg Unified School District
